last_episode_to_air.name: A Sacred Effort
last_episode_to_air.overview: Lincoln wins reelection. In the aftermath of the war, he commits himself to abolishing slavery and passes the 13th Amendment.

name: Lincoln's Dilemma
overview: Insights from a diverse range of journalists, educators and Lincoln scholars, as well as rare archival materials, offer a more nuanced look into the man dubbed the Great Emancipator. The narratives of enslaved people shape a more complete view of an America divided over issues including economy, race and humanity, and underscore Lincoln’s battle to save the country, no matter the cost. Based on acclaimed historian David S. Reynolds’ award-winning book, “Abe: Abraham Lincoln in His Times”.
tagline: History is never made by just one.

episodes.name: The Anti-Slavery Candidate
episodes.overview: As Lincoln prepares to take office, the debate over slavery pushes the country toward a civil war.

episodes.name: So You See, the Man Moves
episodes.overview: Thousands of enslaved people flee north and join Union forces, tipping the scales of military power. Lincoln strategizes the path to reunification.

episodes.name: A New Birth of Freedom
episodes.overview: Lincoln signs the Emancipation Proclamation, but Black Americans like Frederick Douglass know it’s a far cry from abolition.

episodes.name: A Sacred Effort
episodes.overview: Lincoln wins reelection. In the aftermath of the war, he commits himself to abolishing slavery and passes the 13th Amendment.
